page.title: 20Postscript
page.content: The work on the preceding pages has been produced by children,staff and friends of Greenwood and Kingsway Primary Schools in Kirkby-in-Ashfield, a town of about 26000 people.This Nottinghamshire town,which claims to give rise to the Maun,Erewash and Leen rivers,was once an important "railway area" though now it has only a mineral line and no station. What the pages do not show is the range of activities which were engaged in to produce the information,and the value to those involved of observing, researching,questioning,collating, discussing,liaising,etc. It has been an interesting and stimulating project and one which we hope will have long-term benefits for the participants.
